info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Beaufort. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Radar rainfall estimates and automated rain gauges indicate that 1 to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen over the past hour, with the heaviest rain falling in the area near the Marine Corps Air Station. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be possible over the next hour to hour and a half. Flooded roadways will be possible, and travel on Highway 21 could be impacted. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Clarendon, Ladys Island, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Dale, Burton, Laurel Bay, Gardens Corner, Sheldon, Walling Grove, Daniels, Sams Point, Ashdale, Chisolm Point, Coosaw Island, Beaufort Memorial Hospital, Beaufort County Airport, Grays Hill and Dataw Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
